description.narrative: Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities - disaster prevention and preparedness

1. the extent of which Disaster Risk Management System (DRM) clearly define institutional responsibilities and multi-stakeholder coordination
2. number of legislation proposed and drafted

comment.narrative:
1. Not Adequately: very weak fragmented system and absence of disaster risk management entity to streamline and coordinate disaster risk management activities (2013)
2. 0 (2013)

1. Largely: institutional framework for DRM including coordination mechanism developed, well communicated and endorsed by the government
2. 1

1. Largely achieved: Institutional legal framework for Disaster Risk Management drafted and consulted with concerned ministries and civil society organizations. Planning for validation workshop is ongoing to take place in the first week of January.
2. (0) : Legal assessment on existing legislation completed. Drafting of legislation will start after endorsing the proposed disaster risk management institutional framework.

1. Largely: institutional and legal framework for DRM including coordination mechanism developed and consulted with stakeholders and endorsed by the government 2. 1: a proposed disaster risk management law drafted, consulted with stakeholders and submitted to the government for approval

1. Largely achieved: Institutional and legal framework for Disaster Risk Management developed, consulted with line ministries and civil society organizations in National workshop in May 2016 and approved by the Prime Minister's office.
2. (1) : Disaster risk management law was drafted, consulted with stakeholders and submitted to the Prime Minister's office for review

This project aims to promote knowledge and awareness in Human Development in oPt. It is part of a multi-phased programme designed for advocacy in oPt as per UNDP's contribution to setting the development agenda and supporting development debate.

The NHDR project will be implemented in three tracks. It involves the preparation of the NHDR itself, cover the carrying out of the quarterly surveys on perceptions and the production of Human Development materials and programme development support.

This project, through the construction of Industrial hangars in the Jericho Agro Industrial Park, is a second phase of ongoing support under the Supplementary Budget support from Japan for the Fiscal Year 2013.
Construction of Industrial hangars in the Jericho Agro Industrial Park
Accountability - local government finance

title.narrative: Productivity and Urban Renewal in East Jerusalem

description.narrative: Rehabilitation of Shops in Sultan Suliman and Salah Eddin Street in East Jerusalem

Overall objective of the "PURE – Productivity and Urban Renewal in East Jerusalem" is: To improve economic growth and secure social equity and cohesion through a sustainable urban revitalization of the commercial areas of East Jerusalem
Accountability - local government finance
